intro: Alcea galilaea var. rosea, commonly known as the pink hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of southern Europe. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, rose-colored flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
